snippet: Adviser firms are harnessing social science research to humanize financial life counseling in the competition for affluent clients.
abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column highlights survey conducted by Barnaby B Riedel, chief strategist of Riedel Strategy, for investment adviser United Capital about how people view their overall financial life; notes survey is part of growing body of research about aspects of investing and money that cause investors anxiety; observes brokerage firms are trying to harness such research to better attract, retain and serve affluent clients.
lead_paragraph: Adviser firms are harnessing social science research to humanize financial life counseling in the competition for affluent clients.

headline.print_headline: Advisers Who See Themselves in the Life Business
headline.main: Financial Advisers Seek to Inject a More Human Element
